history.content:
Take a class you are interested in and you will most likely succeed

--

Anthro 2ac last fall (with sunseri) was very very easy. Pretty much all you need to do all semester is go to discussion, write two short essays, do a few online quizzes, and write up a (somewhat long) cemetery project. The cemetery project took ~15 hours (counting the actual cemetery visit), the rest of the class was <2 hours / week of work (counting discussion.)

--

Took Music 27 this past semester, and can confirm that it was pretty easy. There were 6 homeworks (each took < 30 minutes), 2 projects (4-5 hours each), midterm, and final. Lectures are a bit dull, but I personally enjoy western classical music, so they were interesting. Curve is pretty generous too, you only need a 90% for an A and the average on the exams were about an 85%, so you're overall grade is boosted by homeworks, projects (average is an A-/A).

Take a class you are interested in and you will most likely succeed

--

Anthro 2ac last fall (with sunseri) was very very easy. Pretty much all you need to do all semester is go to discussion, write two short essays, do a few online quizzes, and write up a (somewhat long) cemetery project. The cemetery project took ~15 hours (counting the actual cemetery visit), the rest of the class was <2 hours / week of work (counting discussion.)

Take a class you are interested in and you will most likely succeed

children.subject: OP here：Yeah..But I basically just want to take one of them as an easy breadth and gpa booster (have no real biased favor or interest for either one of them ).. And I am having hard time deciding..
Can confirm student's answer regarding the ease of 2AC. It was basically background noise during the semester. Solid easy A.

I took Anthro 2AC two years ago, with Lightfoot. Despite it being an 8 am class, it was a smooth, fun ride compared to my technical classes. When I realized I had a few gaps in my knowledge before the final, I just sat in the professor's office and asked him enough questions to fill in those gaps.

history.content:
Hi!  I am wondering which one of Anthro 3AC/2AC , ESPM 50AC , ASAMST W20AC ,Music 27 is the most easy one to get an A and is most suitable to be a GPA booster? 


Berkeleytime shows that ESPM 50AC has the highest A rate (64%, and is the canonical easy-A class), but I heard that ESPM 50AC has a (pretty high) workload. On the other hand, Anthro 2AC/3AC has 45% A rate, which is high but lower than 50AC, but I heard this has lighter workload.



Is it more difficult to get an A on Anthro 2AC/3AC than ESPM 50AC, despite Anthro 2AC/3AC has lighter workload? Or are they pretty much the same difficulty, but Anthro 2AC/3AC has lighter workload?



I also find ASAMST W20AC has very high A rate. And music 27 is the same, but it seems to have lots of memorizing work to do.



I am looking forward for feedbacks, experiences, and suggestions. Thank you so much!



:)
history.subject: Anthro 3AC/2AC vs ESPM 50AC vs ASAMST W20AC vs Music 27?
